intro: Gymnogramma villosula, commonly known as the hairy shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit and features fronds that are typically divided into narrow, linear segments. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments. Gymnogramma villosula has a distinctive appearance with its hairy, velvety texture on the underside of the fronds. This fern is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in indoor conditions.
